[[Overall Operations Commander]] |battles = [[Sri Lankan Civil War]] |awards = |military_blank1 = |military_data1 = |military_blank2 = |military_data2 = |military_blank3 = |military_data3 = |military_blank4 = |military_data4 = |military_blank5 = |military_data5 = }} [[Major General]] [[Deshamanya]] '''Asoka Kanthilal Jayawardena''', [[Rana Wickrama Padakkama|RWP]], [[Rana Sura Padakkama|RSP]], [[Vishista Seva Vibhushanaya|VSV]], [[Uttama Seva Padakkama|USP]], was [[Sri Lanka]]n soldier and politician. He was the former [[Provincial Governors of Sri Lanka|Provincial Governor]] of the [[Governor of North Eastern Province]] and Secretary to the [[Ministry of Defence (Sri Lanka) |Minister of Defence]]. ==Military career== Jayawardena was [[Overall Operations Commander]] (OOC) of the [[Sri Lanka Army]]. In 1997 he was succeeded by Lt. Gen. [[Srilal Weerasooriya]].{{cite web|title=New SLA commander assumes duties|url=http://www.tamilnet.com/art.html?catid=13&artid=2499|publisher=TamilNet|accessdate=9 February 2012}} Jayawardena also served as Security Forces Commander in Jaffna. ==Political career== Retiring from the [[Sri Lanka Army]] in 1998, Jayawardena was appointed as [[Governor of North Eastern Province]]. His predecessor [[Gamini Fonseka]] resigned from the office due to a difference of opinion with the [[President of Sri Lanka|President]] at the time. He is known to be a close confidante of the [[President of Sri Lanka|President]] [[Chandrika Kumaratunga]], and he is believed to be one of her principal military advisors. Jayawardena was the first governor of the province to visit the [[Jaffna peninsula]] after the establishment of the [[North Eastern Provincial Council]].{{cite web|title=Asoka tipped to be new Defence Secretary|url=http://www.island.lk/2004/11/14/politics2.html|publisher=The Island|accessdate=9 February 2012}} ==Awards== His awards and decorations include the Medals; [[Rana Wickrama Padakkama]] (RWP), [[Rana Sura Padakkama]] (RSP), [[Vishista Seva Vibhushanaya]] (VSV) and [[Uttama Seva Padakkama]] (USP).{{cite web|title=History of Governors|url=http://www.np.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_flippingbook&view=book&id=1&Itemid=53|work=Governors of the Northern Provincial Council|publisher=Northern Provincial Council|accessdate=9 February 2012}} In 2005 he was awarded the National title, [[Deshamanya]]. ===Sri Lankan awards=== In Order of Precedence * [[Image:Rana Wickrama Padakkama Bar.PNG|60px]]  [[Rana Wickrama Padakkama]] * [[Image:Rana Sura Padakkama bar.GIF|60px]]  [[Rana Sura Padakkama]] * [[Image:Vishista Seva Vibhushanaya bar.GIF|60px]]  [[Vishista Seva Vibhushanaya]] * [[Image:Uttama Seva Padakkama Bar.gif|60px]]  [[Uttama Seva Padakkama]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Sister project links|Asoka Jayawardena|wikt=no|b=no|s=Mohan Wijewickrama|v=no|author=yes}} *[http://www.np.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_flippingbook&view=book&id=1&Itemid=53 Governors of the Northern Provincial Council - History of Governors] *[http://www.worldstatesmen.org/Sri_Lanka_prov.html Sri Lankan Provinces from 1988 ] {{s-start}} {{s-mil}} |- {{s-bef|before=?}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Overall Operations Commander]]|years=?}} {{s-aft|after=[[Lieutenant-General (Sri Lanka)|Lt.
